ygData.subject: RE: [eqbards] RE: Why Did You Start a Bard?
ygData.msgSnippet: That s the most amazing thing.  Okay - there are a lot of classes and a lot of things to test - and things will get missed.  I can live with that. But what s
ygData.messageBody:
That's the most amazing thing. Okay - there are a lot of classes and a lot
of things to test - and things will get missed. I can live with that.

But what's the point of even having a test server - and having people
report bugs if you're going to ignore them? Pretty sad..

Slyde

-----Original Message-----
From: James Schuldes [mailto:jgs@...]
Sent: Thursday, January 11, 2001 11:05 AM
To: 'eqbards@egroups.com'
Subject: RE: [eqbards] RE: Why Did You Start a Bard?

You would also think that they test stuff or at least listen to the folks
who do. Well, not if you have been playing EQ for very long - they dont test
well at all - who knows why - never have - maybe never will.

This whole Selos problem *was reported one the Test server*! Way before the
recent patch. It was a reported problem on Test.

Sylly
